availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Monmouth, Warren County, Illinois, soldier. Ohio native. Son of Elezear A. Paine and Charlotte Chapin. Served in the 9th Illinois Volunteer Regiment (U.S.A.) as sergeant major in 1861. Served under Brigadier General Eleazer A. Paine as captain and assistant adjutant general from from March 11, 1863. Resigned from the army on January 11, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Illinois, Warren County.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, Warren County, Monmouth, p. 172.
Thomas H. S. Hamersly, Complete Regular Army Register of the United States: for One Hundred Years, (1779-1879) (Washington, D.C.: T. H. S. Hamersly, 1880), p. 81.
“Deaths and Funerals,” The Nebraska State Journal, 5 May 1919.
